items.title: C⁴ Measurement Function
items.content:
322: :label: assump-c4-measurement
323: 
324: The measurement function $d: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ is C⁴ with bounded derivatives:
325: $\|\nabla^m d\| \le d^{(m)}_{\max} < \infty$ for $m = 1, 2, 3, 4$.

334:

336: \|\nabla^m_x K_\rho(x, x')\| \le C_{\nabla^m K}(\rho) \cdot K_\rho(x, x')

items.label: assump-c4-bounded-measurement
items.title: Bounded Measurement Range
items.content:
363: :label: assump-c4-bounded-measurement
364: 
365: The measurement function values are uniformly bounded:
366: 
367: $$
368: |d(x)| \le d_{\max} < \infty \quad \forall x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}
369: 
370: $$
371: 
372: This ensures that centered quantities like $|d(x_i) - \mu_\rho|$ remain bounded by $2d_{\max}$.

items.label: assump-c4-qsd-bounded-density
items.title: QSD Bounded Density (Regularity Condition R2)
items.content:
378: :label: assump-c4-qsd-bounded-density
379: 
380: The quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) has bounded density:
381: 
382: $$
383: 0 < \rho_{\min} \le \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x, v) \le \rho_{\max} < \infty \quad \forall (x, v) \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}} \times B_R(0)
384: 
385: $$
386: 
387: for some velocity ball radius $R > 0$.
388: 
389: **Justification**: This assumption follows from the Foster-Lyapunov convergence conditions established in [06_convergence.md](../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md) Chapter 4. The Foster-Lyapunov drift guarantees exponential convergence to a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) with bounded density on the valid state space. This ensures the walker distribution is well-behaved and prevents pathological concentrations.
390:
items.raw_directive:
375: :::
376: 
377: :::{prf:assumption} QSD Bounded Density (Regularity Condition R2)
378: :label: assump-c4-qsd-bounded-density
379: 
380: The quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) has bounded density:
381: 
382: $$
383: 0 < \rho_{\min} \le \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x, v) \le \rho_{\max} < \infty \quad \forall (x, v) \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}} \times B_R(0)
384: 
385: $$
386: 
387: for some velocity ball radius $R > 0$.
388: 
389: **Justification**: This assumption follows from the Foster-Lyapunov convergence conditions established in [06_convergence.md](../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md) Chapter 4. The Foster-Lyapunov drift guarantees exponential convergence to a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) with bounded density on the valid state space. This ensures the walker distribution is well-behaved and prevents pathological concentrations.
390: 
391: **Usage**: This assumption is critical for sum-to-integral transitions in the centered moment scaling arguments (Lemmas {prf:ref}`lem-mean-fourth-derivative` and {prf:ref}`lem-variance-fourth-derivative`). The bounded density guarantees that discrete sums over walkers can be controlled by continuous integrals weighted by $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$.
